passages.text:
Wigley:Blya!   

...

Well, I wasn't expecting to hear any complaints this early.

[[Why did you slam the door?]]
[[Did the door just slam on its own?]]

links.name: Why did you slam the door?
links.link: Why did you slam the door?

links.name: Did the door just slam on its own?
links.link: Did the door just slam on its own?

passages.name: Separation

passages.text:
Wigley:I didn't.  The Cradle did.  

[[Stalker Forces]]
passages.name: Why did you slam the door?

passages.text:
Wigley:Well, not "on it's own" exactly.  In the way that Marionettes don't move on their own.

[[Stalker Forces]]
passages.name: Did the door just slam on its own?

passages.text:
Wigley:Forces within the cradle have gotten annoyed with us and they decided to let us know, this time a little bit ahead of schedule.

This is one of their favorite tricks.  Splitting caravans.  Producing dramatic noises.  The works.

[[Find a way through]]
passages.name: Stalker Forces

passages.text:
We'll find a way through

[[Is this door locked now?]]
[[(Action) Try to open the door]]
passages.name: Find a way through

passages.text:
Omniscient Voice:You plant your left foot with such firm force it might as well be caked in concrete.  Without thought, your left glute tightens and your core tenses up.  You've adopted the unshakability of a tree stump.  No, you ARE a tree stump.  A stump with a mighty right leg attached.  Without words, you raise your right foot and tuck it in, like a cobra ready to strike.

The moment of action arrives.  Your right foot springs forward like a head springing from a Jack in the Box.  

*kethunk*

First Contact is made.  A ripple shoots through your leg and into your pelvis, dissipating before making it to your torso and left thigh.  The force was completely reflected by the door.  It does not possess the manners to react to your boot in any meaningful way.

Wigley:That's not going to do anything

[[Oww!]]
passages.name: (Action) Try to open the door

passages.text:
Wigley:"Locked" is an understatement.  "Completely sealed" is more accurate.  The will of the Cradle is that this door remains shut.

[[Continue->Find a way through]]
passages.name: Is this door locked now?

passages.text:
Wigley:Yes, Oww. Kicking this door isn't going to do anything.  The Cradle doesn't respond to blunt force trauma like that.

[[That sucks.  Blunt force trauma is my specialty]]
[[What will it respond to?]]

links.name: That sucks.  Blunt force trauma is my specialty
links.link: That sucks.  Blunt force trauma is my specialty

passages.name: Oww!

passages.text:
I admit I'm impressed by your physique.  Most folks in and around the New Euphrates don't share your freakish degree of muscularity.

[[Continue->Door won't move]]
passages.name: That sucks.  Blunt force trauma is my specialty

passages.text:
Probably nothing.  Sometimes there are ways to bargain with The Cradle, but I don't believe this is one of those cases.

[[Continue->Door won't move]]
passages.name: What will it respond to?

passages.text:
No way around it, this door is staying closed.  

[[(Action) Kick it again]]
[[So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: So what are we going to do?
links.link: So what are we going to do?

passages.name: Door won't move

passages.text:
Omniscient Voice:You reassume your primordial stump-like form.  Once again your heel-cobra is unleashed upon the door, your boot landing with a shocking thud with tremendous reverberations arising from your strike.

*kethunk*

Other than the shock waves though, nothing happens.  

Not even Wigley seems impressed.  He seemed at least amused the first time.

Wigley:I told you that wasn't going to do anything.  

[[Door won't move]]
passages.name: (Action) Kick it again

passages.text:
Wigley:Don't worry.  There are many, MANY ways around this door.  

Did I even tell you how I got the name "Wigley?"  It was not my birth name.  I have the soul of an octopus.  

There's an elaborate network of steam tunnels that run all throughout The Cradle.  They're too narrow and contorted for most people to fit through - that's why children were typically selected to maintain and repair them.  But I'm flexible, and skinny, and...Wiggle-y, enough to get through them without much issue, even as an adult.

I'll have to backtrack a bit, but I now a route through the pipes I can follow that should spit me out at the back of the maternity wards.  That's where most of the birth records are anyway, last I checked.  We can reconvene there

[[How am I supposed to navigate this place?]]
[[What if I run into any more electromagnetic phenomena?]]
[[(Continue) Alright, I'll see you on the other side]]

links.name: How am I supposed to navigate this place?
links.link: How am I supposed to navigate this place?

links.name: What if I run into any more electromagnetic phenomena?
links.link: What if I run into any more electromagnetic phenomena?

links.name: (Continue) Alright, I'll see you on the other side
links.link: (Continue) Alright, I'll see you on the other side

passages.name: So what are we going to do?

passages.text:
Don't worry.  This is one of the safest parts of The Cradle.  Even if you do get lost you won't run into much trouble.

And you'll have to try pretty hard to get lost.  The infirmary isn't particularly labyrinth in layout.

[[So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: So what are we going to do?
links.link: So what are we going to do?

passages.name: How am I supposed to navigate this place?

passages.text:
You might have a few more doors slam into your face.  Other than that I wouldn't worry too much.  We're pretty far from the core, so the powers that be have pretty limited recourse, no matter how upset they are.

[[So what are we going to do?]]

links.name: So what are we going to do?
links.link: So what are we going to do?

passages.name: What if I run into any more electromagnetic phenomena?

passages.text:
Wigley: Keep an eye out for some friendly little inhabitants up ahead.  Harmless remnants tend to lurk around the outskirts of the Cradle.  You might find they have some useful info about the documents around.

[[(Continue) Inhabitants?  I thought this place was deserted->Inhabitants]]
[[(Continue) Who should I expect to run into?->Inhabitants]]

links.name: (Continue) Inhabitants?  I thought this place was deserted
(Continue) Who should I expect to run into?

passages.name: (Continue) Alright, I'll see you on the other side

passages.text:
Yeah.  Souls that never really moved on.  Closer to The Core we might run into some antagonistic entities, but everyone here on the outskirts is largley harmless.

I've got to go.  Remember, we'll meet up on the opposite edge of the infirmary.
passages.name: Inhabitants
